contentrichtext.text: '''John Chapman''' may refer to: *[[John Chapman (theologian)]] (1704–1784), English cleric and scholar *[[Sir John Chapman, 2nd Baronet]] (c. 1710–1781), British Member of Parliament for Taunton, 1741–1747 *[[John Chapman (congressman)]] (1740–1800), United States Representative from Pennsylvania *[[Johnny Appleseed]] (John Chapman, 1774–1845), pioneer nurseryman and missionary *[[John Grant Chapman]] (1798–1856), Maryland politician *[[Jonathan Chapman]] (1807–1848), American politician *[[John Gadsby Chapman]] (1808–1889), American artist *[[John Chapman (1810–1877)]], British Member of Parliament for Grimsby, 1862–1865 and 1874–1877 *[[John Chapman (publisher)]] (1821–1894), publisher of the ''Westminster Review'' *[[John Chapman Andrew]] (1822–1907), Member of Parliament in New Zealand *[[John Ratcliffe Chapman]] (1815–1899), British-American rifle scope designer *[[Jack Chapman]] (1843–1916), baseball player and manager *[[John Otho Chapman]] (1931–2011), politician in Saskatchewan, Canada *[[John Wilbur Chapman]] (1859–1918), American Presbyterian evangelist *[[John Jay Chapman]] (1862–1933), American essayist and dramatist *[[John Linton Chapman]] (1839-1905), American painter *[[John Chapman (priest)]] (1865–1933), British priest, abbot, and religious scholar *[[John Chapman (cricketer)]] (1877–1956), English cricketer for Derbyshire *[[John Chapman (general)]] (1896–1963), Australian Army general of WWII *[[John Chapman (Australian politician)]] (1879–1931), Australian Senator *[[John Chapman (footballer)]], footballer and manager from 1906 *[[John William Chapman]] (1894–1978), Lieutenant Governor of Illinois, 1953–1961 *[[John Chapman (baseball)]] (1899–1953), former shortstop for the Philadelphia Athletics *[[John Arthur Chapman]] (1900–1972), American theatre critic *[[John Herbert Chapman]] (1921–1979), Canadian space researcher *[[John Chapman (English writer)]] (1927–2001), English playwright and screenwriter *[[John Chapman (evangelist)]], Australian evangelist *[[John Chapman (bishop)]], Anglican bishop in Canada *[[John Chapman (artist)]] (born 1946), artist from Blackburn, Lancashire *[[John A. Chapman]] (1965–2001), USAF [[Combat Controller]], posthumously awarded the [[Air Force Cross (United States)|Air Force Cross]] *[[Johnny Chapman]] (born 1967), NASCAR driver <!--Do try and put the entries in date order... --> {{hndis|Chapman, John}}
